title: Feeding Mars: Hydroponics Aeroponics and GMO's

tasks.task: Feeding a Martian population through innovative agricultural practices.
subtasks: Research and development of hydroponics and aeroponics systems.
Design and construction of Martian greenhouses.
Cultivate genetically modified crops in the greenhouses.
Adapt earth crops to Martian environmental conditions (lower gravity, higher radiation, special soil).
Ensure food security on Mars through sustainable farming methods.
Extend agricultural research beyond plant-based foods.

tasks.task: Care for crops in a Martian hydroponic/aeroponic system.
subtasks: Install and maintain hydroponic/aeroponic equipment.
Prepare nutrient-rich water solutions for crop hydration.
Regularly monitor crop growth and environmental conditions.
Adjust system parameters as needed (e.g., lighting, nutrient concentrations,circulation).
Harvest and collect crops for distribution.

tasks.task: Genetic modification of crops for Mars.
subtasks: Identify Earth crops suitable for Martian conditions.
Modify plants to withstand low gravity (e.g., alter root structure).
Enhance radiation tolerance in plants.
Adapt soil compatibility for Martian regolith.
Test and develop GMO traits for resilience.
Select a suitable location on Mars for the greenhouse.
Build the physical structure of the greenhouse (e.g., panels, glazing).
Install equipment for climate control (temperature, humidity).
Set up hydroponic/aeroponic units within the greenhouse.
Integrate climate monitoring and automation systems.

tasks.task: Monitoring and adjusting environmental conditions in a greenhouse.
subtasks: Regularly check temperature and humidity levels.
Adjust heating and cooling systems as required.
Monitor and manage CO2 levels for photosynthesis.
Regulate lighting cycles for plant growth.
Control air circulation and ventilation.
